required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SHR6390 Combined With Pyrotinib in HER2+ Advanced Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of CDK4/6 Inhibitor SHR6390 Combined With Pyrotinib in the Treatment of HER2-positive Advanced Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study was to observe the efficacy and safety of treatment with pyrotinib and CDK4/6 inhibitor SHR6390 for HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of treatment to Disease Progress, assessed up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: ORR by investigator using RECIST Guideline (Version 1.1)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the first drug administration to 30 days from the last dose, assessed up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients experiencing any adverse events (AE) during the study time

arm_group.description: Patients with HER2 positive breast cancer will receive Pyrotinib in combination with SHR6390(at protocol defined dose levels) orally until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, withdrawal of consent or death, whichever occurs first.
